divs: sighting detailsconditions were scatter high thin clouds. vissibility good. went outside my house at aproxiamateley 7:50 to have a cigarette. was facing sw looking at the moon 3\4 full, venus, and the stars when i saw a bright light bluish white in color high in the sky come over the roof of my house moving fast in a se heading. it was as bright as venus, as i could see venus to my right, but not as high in the sky maybe 30 thousand ft or more. at first i thought it was a passenger jet with landing light turned on for some unknown reason, but it was moving to fast and then it did a quick zig zag to the left and then back right then continued heading se. i kept watching it thinking maybe my eyes were playing tricks on me for about a minute or so as it was heading toward a small high thin cloud. it started going behind the cloud and i could still see it through the cloud due to the brightness of the object. at about half way through the cloud it disappeared. i kept watching since i could see all sides of the cloud waiting for it to appear on the side or even heading in another direction, but it never did. i kept watching for about 5 more minutes and scanning the sky where it should of been, when a bright shooting star or fireball appeared out of nowhere real low in the sky heading in the oppsite direction nw. the hieght of the fireball i estimate to be about 100 hundred to a thousand ft above the tree line. i estimate the distance away from me to be about a 1-3 miles as there is a mountian range 5-10 miles away from my house wich you could see that night and the fireball was in front of the range. the fireball also had a real low angle of entry almost flat with a tail behind it. it lasted about 5 seconds and i could see splinters come off it as it was burning up. i waited about five more minutes but saw nothing else and went inside to tell my wife. i don't believe the first object was an asteroid as it was going to slow, and not a jet or satelitte as it was going to fast and did that quick zig zag manuver. i also know the most of the traffic patterns in the area above my house fairly good and it wasn't on a flight course i recognize. i star gaze all the time and can tell the differance between jets, planes, and helicopters as i live only a mile away from a small community air port. the object was also way to high for a plane landing there. what strikes me as odd is seeing the object and then the shooting star so close in time together with the appearing so low out of nowhere and going in the opposite direction with parts splintering off. i can't say it isn't possible, but find it highly improbable.
